intro: Oliveriana ecuadorensis, commonly known as the Ecuadorian Oliveria, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andean regions of Ecuador. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments within cloud forests, where it forms dense undergrowth. Its roots contain nitrogen-fixing bacteria, contributing to soil fertility in its natural habitat. Oliveriana ecuadorensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological role and potential medicinal properties.
